items.title: Nifty’s fastest mover Bajaj Finance faces a growth bottleneck as swelling loan book raises red flags. What lies ahead?
items.description: Bajaj Finance, Nifty's top performer, faces a growth slowdown due to stress in SME and captive 2/3 wheeler loan segments. The company has cut its growth guidance for FY26 to 22-23%, expecting asset quality to improve by Q4FY26/Q1FY27. New growth engines are expected to partially offset the impact.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Goldman Sachs maintains buy on Info Edge; Elara Securities recommends sell on Asian Paints
items.description: Brokerages offered mixed views on key stocks as Goldman Sachs reaffirmed its bullish stance on Info Edge, citing improved valuations, while Elara Securities maintained a cautious ‘Sell’ on Asian Paints due to limited growth. Morgan Stanley remained positive on Tata Steel, highlighting strong quarterly results and sustained margin recovery momentum.

items.title: Gujarat Fluorochemicals, Hexaware Tech among 5 stocks showing bullish signals
items.description: Five stocks in the Nifty500 pack came to the bullish scanner of "White Marubozu" on November 12, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It occurs when the opening price is the lowest for a given period, and the closing price is the highest.Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers were in control from the opening to the closing, often using such patterns for informed decisions about future price movements in financial markets."

items.title: Sensex drops 50 pts, Nifty below 25,850 as D-St awaits cues on India-U.S. trade deal
items.description: Indian stocks traded lower on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty snapping a three-day winning streak. Investors watched for progress on a potential India-U.S. trade agreement. Financial and IT shares led the declines. However, the market soon saw a quick recovery and traded in the green. Midcap and smallcap stocks edged up.

items.title: Ashok Leyland shares in focus as Q2 net profit rises 7% to Rs 820 crore. Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.description: Ashok Leyland share price: Ashok Leyland reported a 7% YoY rise in Q2 net profit to Rs 820 crore, driven by strong exports, operational efficiencies, and steady margins. Brokerages remain bullish, with Nomura and Morgan Stanley raising target prices, citing improved profitability, structural growth, and attractive valuations.

items.title: Info Edge shares in focus as Q2 profit soars 1,260%; check Goldman Sachs and Nomura’s target prices
items.description: Info Edge reported a sharp 1,260% YoY jump in Q2 profit to Rs 316 crore, driven by higher revenue and exceptional gains. Revenue rose 15% to Rs 805 crore, with billings up 12% YoY. Brokerages Nomura and Goldman Sachs maintained Buy ratings, citing strong margins, stable growth outlook, and attractive valuations despite muted hiring trends.

items.title: Asian Paints shares jump 4% to fresh 52-week high on Q2 beat. Should investors buy, sell, or hold?
items.description: Asian Paints shares surged to a new high after reporting a strong 43 percent profit jump for the September quarter. Decorative paint demand and cost savings fueled this growth. Revenues also saw a rise. While the company declared a dividend, analysts hold differing views on its stock valuation and future growth prospects.

items.title: M&M shares in focus after announcing 50:50 life insurance JV with Manulife
items.description: Mahindra & Mahindra announced a 50:50 life insurance joint venture with Manulife, approved by its board on November 12. The JVCo will offer life insurance solutions in India, with an initial investment of Rs 1,250 crore from each party. This venture aims to tap into India's growing life insurance market, particularly in rural and semi-urban areas.

items.title: FIIs pull out Rs 80,000 crore from 10 bluechip stocks but the selling may finally be getting over
items.description: Foreign investors have withdrawn substantial funds from top Indian stocks. However, a shift is occurring with expectations that the worst is over. Domestic mutual funds are increasing their holdings, providing market stability. Analysts are optimistic about India's future growth prospects, projecting potential gains for the Nifty index.

items.title: Parag Milk Foods, Max Financial Services among 7 stocks hitting 5-year swing highs
items.description: In the NSE list of stocks with a market cap over Rs 1,000 crore, seven stocks hit a 5-year swing high at the close on November 12, suggesting bullishness in these counters, according to StockEdge.com's technical scan data.A 5-year swing high represents the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year timeframe. This level acts as a key resistance point, beyond which the price has historically struggled to move. Such a move may be seen as a bullish signal, indicating potential for further upward momentum. However, it differs from a 5-year breakout, which occurs when a stock’s price surpasses a key resistance level that has held for five years or more.

items.title: Asian Paints posts first double-digit sales volume growth in 7 quarters
items.description: Asian Paints reported double-digit sales volume growth in its decorative paints segment for the first time in seven quarters, helping it surpass July–September profit estimates. The company also posted year-on-year net profit growth for the first time in six quarters, supported by improved operations. Sales volume rose 10.9% and value increased 6%, aided by a low base from last year.

items.title: Shringar House of Mangalsutra shares in focus as Q2 PAT rises over 42% YoY
items.description: Shringar House of Mangalsutra posted a robust Q2FY26 performance, with PAT rising 42.5% YoY to Rs 22.85 crore. Revenue grew 27% to Rs 528.79 crore, while EBITDA and gross margins expanded. The company also launched its 24K SHUDDH Hallmarked Mangalsutra collection, boosting product offerings.

items.title: Ather Energy shares in focus as NIIF II likely to offload up to 2.3% stake via block deal
items.description: Ather Share price: NIIF II is set to sell up to 2.34% of its Ather Energy stake through a block deal, with the floor price fixed at Rs 620 per share. The transaction, valued at around Rs 551 crore, will be executed via the open market block window mechanism, potentially altering the company’s shareholding structure.

items.title: Tata Steel shares rise 3% after Q2 PAT surges fourfold to Rs 3,183 crore
items.description: Tata Steel share price: Tata Steel's September quarter profit soared fourfold to Rs 3,183 crore, driven by robust Indian sales and improved Netherlands operations. Consolidated sales climbed nearly 9% to Rs 58,689 crore, with Ebitda jumping 46%. The company also saw a reduction in UK operating losses and a decrease in tax expenses, signaling a strong financial performance.

items.title: Mamaearth shares surge 9% as co swings to Rs 39 crore profit in Q2
items.description: Honasa Consumer, the company behind Mamaearth, has reported a strong financial performance. The company achieved a net profit of Rs 39 crore in the second quarter of FY26. This marks a significant recovery from a net loss in the same period last year. Revenue from operations also saw a healthy year-on-year growth.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: KEC International, Jindal Stainless among 5 stocks that could give 10-40% return
items.description: Brokerage houses remain optimistic on select mid- and large-cap names across sectors, highlighting strong growth potential and reasonable valuations.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:
